meta.title: Madura United FC - Official Website
meta.description: Official website of Madura United Football Club - Sape Kerrab Madura United!

footer.address: Jl. Raya Panglegur No. 10, Pamekasan, Madura, East Java
footer.brand_desc: It was the end of a period in the 1980s in which it seemed like every championship matchup featured the Laskar Sape Kerrab sports club.

players.title: Players
players.description: Explore the full Madura United squad from the first team to the future players in the Academy.

about.org_structure_subtitle: The management structure of Madura United FC displayed in a tiered (pyramid) format based on positions.

history.title: History & Journey of Madura United FC
history.desc: The long journey of Madura United FC is rooted in the history of its predecessors. From the era of Pelita Jaya which became the professional foundation, the transformation into Pelita Bandung Raya, to the birth of a new identity as Madura United FC representing four regencies on Madura Island.

foundation.label: Foundation Era
foundation.title: Pelita Jaya (1986 – 2012)
foundation.body: It all started with Pelita Jaya, one of the pioneers of professional clubs in Indonesia. In this era, the club built a great reputation in the Galatama competition and was known as an elite team that produced many national football legends. Although its base moved several times, the value of professionalism instilled since 1986 became a strong foundation for the club's future existence.

transition.label: Transition Era
transition.title: Pelita Bandung Raya (2012 – 2015)
transition.body: Entering 2012, the club transformed into Pelita Bandung Raya (PBR). This was a period of trial and proof. PBR surprised the national football public by reaching the semifinals of the 2014 Indonesia Super League (ISL). However, the dynamics of national football in late 2015 demanded major changes to maintain the club's survival.

revival.label: Revival Era
revival.title: Madura United FC (2016 – Present)
revival.body1: This is the era where the club finally found its true home and identity. Through the acquisition by Prof. Achsanul Qosasi on January 10, 2016, the club officially moved to Madura Island. More than just a name change, this is a declaration of independence for Madura's people's football.
revival.body2: Madura United made history as a club that unites four regencies at once — Bangkalan, Sampang, Pamekasan, and Sumenep — under one banner, Laskar Sape Kerrab.
revival.body3: In a short time, the club has consistently been at the top of Liga 1. Most recently, Madura United secured the Runner-up position in the 2023/2024 season and began spreading its wings in international competition through the AFC Challenge League 2024/2025.

vision.title: To become a professional football club that is independent, modern, and a center of football development in Indonesia.
vision.subtext: This vision serves as the main compass in every step of Madura United FC, both on and off the field.

development.title: Early Youth Development
development.text: Through Madura United Football Academy (MUFA), the club is committed to producing talented native Madurese players to reach the national and international level.

identity.title: Regional Identity
identity.text: Strengthening Madura's identity in the national football scene by upholding high local values.

management.title: Modern Management
management.text: Managing the club transparently, accountably, and based on a sustainable sports industry.

philosophy.title: Logo & Color Philosophy
philosophy.subtitle: The identity of Madura United FC is not only visible, but also holds meaning about character, culture, and fighting spirit.
philosophy.logo_caption: Official Logo of Madura United FC
philosophy.callout_text: The logo becomes a symbol of pride, togetherness, and ambition for Madura United to always appear brave and dignified.

01.title: Shape Without Sharp Corners (Inclusive Shield)
01.text1: Unlike many club logos that have sharp corners at the bottom, Madura United's logo is round/curved (resembling a jar or blunt shield).
01.text2: Symbolizes that this club is an inclusive vessel embracing all groups. This club is not rigid, but flexible and open to all Madurese people regardless of background.

02.title: Bull Figure (Sape Kerrab)
02.text1: Not just any bull, this represents the Karapan Bull.
02.text2: Symbolizes the Self-Esteem (Dignity) and Prestige of Madurese people. Karapan bulls are known for their speed, strength, and toughness—reflecting the team's fighting spirit on the field.

03.title: Gold Ring in Bull's Nose (Keles)
03.text1: There is a gold detail on the bull's nose.
03.text2: In Madurese culture, the best Karapan bulls wear gold jewelry. This symbolizes achievement, glory, and the club's ambition to always be in the highest caste (gold/champion).

04.title: Red & White Colors
04.text: Taken from the Pesa'an traditional clothing motif. Red symbolizes courage and firmness, while White symbolizes honesty and sportsmanship.

homebase.title: Home Base
homebase.subtitle: Two perspectives on Madura United's home — match atmosphere and the pulse of club activity.

suramadu.title: SURAMADU SUPER CUP CHAMPION
suramadu.desc: Winner of the 2018 international pre-season tournament.

runnerup.title: LIGA 1 RUNNER-UP
runnerup.desc: Highest achievement in the 2023/2024 Championship Series season.

afc.title: AFC CLUB LICENSING
afc.desc: Professional club with Asian standards routinely recognized.

fairplay.title: FAIR PLAY TEAM AWARD
fairplay.desc: Award for the most sporting team in the 2021/2022 season.

program.junior_desc: Focus on mastering basic techniques, character, and simple tactical understanding as the foundation for modern players.
program.youth_desc: Deepening tactics, high-intensity training, and acclimatization to the rhythm of elite national competition.
program.pro_desc: Preparing players for the transition to the professional level, including EPA, Liga 2, and promotion to the senior team.
program.subtitle: Three interconnected program levels, designed to guide young players towards a professional career with Madura United FC.
program.monitoring_note: Each participant will undergo a selection process, structured training, and regular development monitoring by the MUFA coaching staff.

facilities.homebase_subtitle: A comfortable and controlled dormitory environment to support the development of young players.
facilities.mutg_subtitle: The main training facility of the Madura United Training Ground (MUTG).
facilities.equipment_subtitle: Professional-standard training equipment to support player development.
facilities.equipment_note: *Does not include personal sports equipment (such as football boots, etc.).
